alert.note: Alert for Pecos; Terrell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:33PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Pecos and northeastern Terrell Counties through 715 PM CDT... At 633 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 19 miles northwest of Sheffield, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sheffield, Iraan, Iraan Municipal Airport, Bakersfield and Girvin. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 288 and 327. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southwestern Texas.
